article.title: Raytheon to Support Vertical Take-off UAV Ground Stations
article.author: George Seffers
article.text: Raytheon Intelligence and Information Systems, Dulles, Virginia, is being awarded a $27,883,883 cost-plus-incentive-fee, firm-fixed-price contract for efforts required to complete Linux transition on the tactical control system software for vertical take-off unmanned air vehicle ground control stations.Â The Naval Air Systems Command, Patuxent River, Maryland, is the contracting activity.
